page.title: 18HOLDENHURST, THEN AND NOW
page.content: Holdenhurst was known as{Holeest}in 1086,and consisted of 22 hides and half a virgate. There was land for 20 ploughs (approximately 2400 acres) and 181 acres of meadow land. The population was at least 380. It was an agricultural community.Today there are 25 people living in the village, 14 around the green.In 1086 the woodland was oak and beech, and today oaks are prominent and some are 200 years old. There is a horse chestnut tree which is 300 years old and the oldest tree in Bournemouth.The community is still based on agriculture although there are a baker,a florist and a teacher living in the village. The church was built in 1833 and stands on the site of the original Anglo-Saxon church.The village,though small has many convenieces.The green remains the focal point of this delightful village
